alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:32PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lake County through 600 PM PDT... At 529 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Summer Lake Wildlife Area, or 15 miles southeast of Silver Lake, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm is also producing heavy downpours which could limit visibility and result in ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Summer Lake Wildlife Area, Silver Lake and Farm Well Campground And Trailhead. This includes Highway 31 in Oregon between mile markers 48 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water on roadways. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
